intro: Bulbostylis hispidula subsp. intermedia, commonly known as the hairy bulbostylis, is a small, grass-like plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The species is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the Cyperaceae family. This plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often in disturbed or nutrient-rich soils.
